page.title: 15CELTIC PLACENAMES
page.content: IN THIS AREA, AS IN MOST OF CORNWALL, PLACENAMES REFLECT THE CELTIC ROOTS OF THE PEOPLE AND LANGUAGE. MANY CORNISH PLACE-NAMES ARE SIMILAR TO THOSE FOUND IN WALES AND BRITANNY. THIS IS BECAUSE, UNTIL THE TWELFTH CENTURY, THE CORNISH, BRETONS AND WELSH WERE ONE PEOPLE WITH ONE LANGUAGE. ST. TETHA HERSELF WAS A CELTIC SAINT. SOME EXAMPLES OF CELTIC PLACE-NAMES IN AND AROUND ST. TEATH ARE: HENDRA, TREKEE, SUFFENTON, TREWETHEN, FENTENGO TREHANNICK, TREWENNEN, TREVEIGHAN, TRELILL, PENGENNA, CARKEEN AND TREROOSEL. MANY OF THESE PLACES ARE ANCIENT FARMSTEADS MENTIONED IN DOCUMENTS GOING BACK TO THE TWELFTH CENTURY AND BEYOND. TREROOSEL AND POLROAD MANORS ARE MENTIONED IN THE DOMESDAY BOOK.
